answers-to-the-practice-questions_chapte: In Excel, spreadsheets can have values of data types other than strings; cells can have different fonts, sizes, or color settings; cells can have varying widths and heights; adjacent cells can be merged; and you can embed images and charts.
You pass a File object, obtained from a call to open().
File objects need to be opened in read-binary ('rb') for Reader objects and write-binary ('wb') for Writer objects.
The delimiter argument changes the string used to separate cells in a row. The lineterminator argument changes the string used to separate rows.
